oam.a: oam.a kt [sie] be drenched, be saturated in water. (tde) oamia; (tdk) oamika; (tds) oamisha.
oan.a: oan.a kt [sie] 1 be married. 2 be compatible, be in harmony: Mawazo yake yame~ na yangu her views are in harmony with mine. (tde) oania; (tdk) oanika; (tds) oanisha.
og.a:
og.a1 kt [sie/ele] bath, take a bath/shower. (tde) ogea; (tdk) ogeka; (tds) ogesha.

PREPENDED -oga2 kv coward, timid.
ogop.a: ogop.a kt [sie] 1 fear, be afraid/ fearful. 2 obey: ~ Mwenyezi Mungu obey the Almighty God. (tde) ogopea; (tdk) ogopeka; (tds) ogopesha; (tdn) ogopana; (tdw) ogopwa.
omb.a: omb.a kt [ele] beg for, ask for, petition, request; pray for. (tde) ombea; (tdk) ombeka; (tdn) ombana; (tds) ombesha; (tdw) ombwa.
ombe: ombe nm [i-/zi-]1 edge, rim, brim. 2 uncertain wavering movement.
ombe.a: ombe.a kt [ele] pray for, intercede for. 2 ask on behalf of: Naku~ ruhusa I am asking for permission on your behalf. (tdk) ombeka.
omboje: omboje.a kt [sie] be too soft, become too soft. (tdk) ombojeka; (tds) ombojesha; (tdw) ombojewa.
ombolekez.a: ombolekez.a kt [ele] recite words during oath taking/offering. (tde) ombolekezea; (tdk) ombole-kezeka; (tds) ombolekezesha; (tdn) ombolekezana; tdw) ombo-lekezwa.
omek.a: omek.a kt [ele] 1 pile up, stack sth up. 2 compress, press; fill. (tde) omekea; (tdk) omekeka; (tds) omekesha; (tdn) omekana; (tdw) omekwa.
on.a: on.a kt [ele] 1 see: Kusikia si ku~ hearing is not the same as seeing. 2 feel: Na~ njaa I am feeling hungry. (tde) onea; (tdk) oneka; (tdn) onana; (tds) onesha; (tdw) onwa.
onan.a: onan.a kt [sie] meet, see: Ali~ na rafiki yake jana he met his friend yesterday. (tde) onania; (tdk) onanika; (tds) onanisha.
ondokan.a: ondokan.a kt [sie]~ na get rid of sth, escape from, be delivered from, emerge from: Ame~ na tabia ya ombaomba he has been delivered from beggary.
ondoke.a: ondoke.a kt [sie] 1 feel better, be feeling better. 2 prosper, do well: Mtoto ana~ vizuri the child is prospering well.
ondoleo: ondoleo nm ma- [li-/ya-] remission, removal: ~ la dhambi remission of sins.
onekan.a: onekan.a kt [sie] 1 be seen, be vissible, be apparent. 2 appear like/as if: Ina~ mvua itanyesha it appers as if it will rain. (tde) onekania; (tdk) onekanika; (tds) onekanisha.
onele.a: onele.a kt [sie] feel, think, consider: Nili~ bora nirudi nyumbani I felt it's best I returned home.
ongeze.a: ongeze.a kt [ele] add to/for, increase: Nitaku~ mshahara wako I shall increase your salary.
ongezeko: ongezeko nm ma- [li-/ya-] increment, surplus: ~ la misha-hara salary increment.
ongo.a: ongo.a kt [ele] 1 reform, convert, set right. 2 soothe a child by soft songs. (tde) ongolea, (tdw) ongolewa; (tdk) ongoleka; (tdn) ongoana.
ongoz.a: ongoz.a kt [ele] 1 lead, guide, show the way. 2 direct, conduct. (tde) ongozea; (tdk) ongozeka; (tdn) ongozana; (tdw) ongozwa.
ongozan.a: ongozan.a kt [sie] 1 go along together, follow one another. 2 guide one another. (tde) ongozania; (tdk) ongozanika; (tds) ongozanisha.
onjesh.a: onjesh.a kt [ele] give to taste, offer to taste. (tde) onjeshea; (tdk) onjesheka; (tdn) onjeshana; (tdw) onjeshwa.
onyesho: onyesho nm ma- [li-/ya-] 1 scene (in a play).2 exhibition, show: Ma~ ya vitabu book exhibition/fair.
opo.a:
opo.a kt [ele] 1 draw out, remove, take off/out: ~ ndoo kisimani fish a bucket orodha

PREPENDED out of a well. 2 save, rescue, deliver; remove a magic spell. (tde) opolea, (tdew) opolewa; (tdk) opoka; (tds) oposha; (tdn) opoana.
orodhesh.a:
orodhesh.a* kt [ele] list, catalogue, compile an inventory. (tde) oro-dheshea; (tdk) orodhesheka; (tdn) orodheshana; (tdw) orodheshwa (Kar)

PREPENDED -ororo kv soft, smooth: Ngozi ny~ smooth skin; Muziki mw~ soft music.
osh.a: osh.a kt [ele] wash: ~ vyombo vya kulia wash the utensils. (tde) oshea; (tdk) osheka; (tdn) oshana; (tdw) oshwa.
ot.a: ot.a1 kt [ele/sie] germinate, grow, sprout, spring up: Mtama ume~ the sorghum has sprout up; ~ meno cut teeth. (tde) otea; (tdk) oteka; (tds) otesha.
ot.a<sup>4</sup>:
ot.a4 kt [ele] get warm: ~ jua bask

PREPENDED in the sun. (tde) otea; (tdk) oteka;

PREPENDED (tds) otesha; (tdw) otwa.
otam.a:
otam.a kt [sie] squat. (tde) otamia; (tdk) otamika; (tds) otamisha.

PREPENDED -o-ote kl any: Una kitabu chochote? do you have any book?

PREPENDED -ote kv all, whole, entire: Watu w~ all people; Vitabu vy~ all books; shule ya~ the entire school.
ote.a:
ote.a1 kt [sie] 1 lie in ambush,

PREPENDED waylay, lurk. 2 (mchezo wa mpira) be off side. (tdn) oteana; (tdw) otewa.
ovodh.a:
ovodh.a kt [sie] swim in order to guard the drag-net. (tde) ovodhea; (tdk) ovodheka; (tds) ovodhesha.

PREPENDED -ovu kv evil, vile, wicked: Yu mw~ he is wicked.
oya: oya1 nm ma- [li-/ya-] handful (of sth): ~ ya mchele a handful of rice.
oz.a: oz.a1 kt [sie] rot, go bad, putrefy; stink; (nyama) be high. (tde) ozea; (tdk) ozeka; (tds) ozesha.
oz.a<sup>2</sup>: oz.a2 kt [sie] marry off sb: Jirani yetu atamw~ binti yake juma lijalo our neighbour will marry off his daughter next week. (tde) ozea; (tdk) ozeka. (tds) ozesha; (tdn) ozana; (tdw) ozwa.
